description: Number of balanced partitions of n: the smallest part equals the number of parts.
comments: Or, number of partitions of n in which number of largest parts is equal to the largest part.The number of partitions of n+1 without parts that differ by less than 2 and which have no parts less than three. [MacMahon]There are two conflicting choices for the offset in this sequence. For the definition given here the offset is 1, and that is what we shall adopt. On the other hand, if one arrives at this sequence via the Rogers-Ramanujan identities (see the next comment), the natural offset is 0.Related to Rogers-Ramanujan identities: Let G[1](q) and G[2](q) be the generating functions for the two Rogers-Ramanujan identities of A003114 and A003106, starting with the constant term 1. The g.f. for the present sequence is G[3](q) = (G[1](q) - G[2](q))/q = 1+q^3+q^4+q^5+q^6+q^7+2*q^8+2*q^9+3*q^10+.... - _Joerg Arndt_, Oct 08 2012; _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 18 2015For more about the generalized Rogers-Ramanujan series G[i](x) see the Andrews-Baxter and Lepowsky-Zhu papers. The present series is G[3](x). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 22 2015

formula: G.f.: sum(m>=1, (x^(m^2)-x^(m*(m+1))) / prod(i=1..m, 1-x^i) ).G.f.: sum(n>=1, x^(n^2)/prod(k=1..n-1, 1-x^k) ). - _Joerg Arndt_, Jan 29 2011a(n) = A003114(n)-A003106(n) = A039900(n)-A039889(n), (offset 1). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 17 2004Plouffe in his 1992 dissertation conjectured that this has g.f. = (1+z+z**4+2*z**5-z**3-z**8+3*z**10-z**7+z**9)/(1+z-z**4-2*z**3-z**8+z**10), but _Michael Somos_ pointed out on Jan 22 2008 that this is false.Expansion of ( f(-x^2, -x^3) - f(-x, -x^4) ) / f(-x) in powers of x where f() is Ramanujan's theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 22 2007
example: a(15) = 5 because the partitions of 15 where the samllest part equals the number of parts are3 + 6 + 6,3 + 5 + 7,3 + 4 + 8,3 + 3 + 9, and2 + 13.- _Joerg Arndt_, Oct 08 2012
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n<0, 0, `if`(n=0, 1,      `if`(i<1, 0, b(n, i-1)+`if`(i>n, 0, b(n-i,i)))))    end:a:= n-> add(b(n-j^2, j-1), j=0..isqrt(n)):seq (a(n), n=1..80);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 08 2012
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n<0, 0, If[n == 0, 1, If[i<1, 0, b[n, i-1] + If[i>n, 0, b[n-i, i]]]]]; a[n_] := Sum[b[n-j^2, j-1], {j, 0, Sqrt[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 80}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 17 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, polcoeff( sum(k=1, sqrtint(n), x^k^2 / prod(j=1, k-1, 1 - x^j, 1 + O(x ^ (n - k^2 + 1) ))), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 22 2008 */
